intro: Miconia teotepecensis, commonly known as the Teotepec miconia, is a member of the Melastomataceae family and is native to the humid forests of southern Mexico. It is a shrub or small tree that can grow up to 5 meters in height, characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves with prominent veins. The plant produces showy, pinkish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically visited by various pollinators. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that release small, winged seeds when mature. Miconia teotepecensis is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in shaded understory conditions.
